sen.j: 防人（さきもり）は古代中国や、日本の飛鳥時代から平安時代、律令制度下で行われた軍事制度である。
sen.e: Sakimori is a military institution carried out in ancient China and in Japan during Asuka period to Heian period based on the philosophies of Confucianism and Chinese Legalism.

Sakimori is a military system carried out under in ancient China and in Japan under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) from the Asuka period to the Heian period.

sen.j: 中国では辺境領の警備のために設置され、農村から徴兵された。
sen.e: In China, Sakimori was deployed for the security of outlying territories and the soldiers were drafted from farming villages.
In China, sakimori ('fangren' in Chinese) was deployed for the security of outlying territories and the soldiers were conscripted from farming villages.

sen.j: 任期は3年だが、延長される事もしばしばあった。
sen.e: The term of service was three years although it was often extended.

sen.j: 食料・武器は自弁であった。
sen.e: They needed to bring their food and their weapons by themselves.

sen.j: 日本の防人は、大化の改新の後、663年に朝鮮半島の百済救済のために出兵した倭軍が白村江の戦いにて唐・新羅の連合軍に大敗したことを契機に、唐が攻めてくるのではないかとの憂慮から九州沿岸の防衛のため設置された辺境防備の兵である。
sen.e: In Japan, Sakimori was deployed for the defence of outlying territories such as the coast of Kyushu for fear of Tang's possible invasion after the major defeat of Japanese troops, who had been dispatched to rescue Baekje in Korean peninsula, against allied troops of Tang and Silla at the Battle of Baekgang in 663.

In Japan, sakimori was deployed for the defence of outlying territories such as the coast of Kyushu due to the fear of a possible invasion by Tang Dynasty China after the major defeat suffered by Japanese troops, who had been dispatched to aid Baekje on the Korean peninsula, by the allied forces of Tang Dynasty China and the Silla Kingdom at the Battle of Baekgang in 663.

sen.j: 中国同様、任期は3年で諸国の軍団から派遣され、任期は延長される事がよくあり、食料・武器は自弁であった。
sen.e: Same as that in China, the term of service was three years, which was often extended, and the soliders, who were sent from provincial corps, needed to bring their food and their weapons by themselves.

As was the case in China, the term of service was three years, troops were dispatched from provincial legions, the term of service was often extended, and soldiers had to pay for their own food and weaponry.

sen.e: Dazaifu, the administrative center of Kyushu, took command of them.
These forces were under the command of the Dazai-fu (local government office in the Kyushu region)

sen.j: 主に人口の多い東日本から徴兵され、その間も税は免除される事はないため、農民にとっては重い負担であり、兵士の士気は低かったと考えられている。
sen.e: Although the soliders were mainly drafted from eastern Japan, which had a larger pupulation, no tax exemption was allowed during their service, putting a heavy burden on them and driving their morale seemingly lower.

Because the soldiers, who were mainly drafted from eastern Japan which had a larger population, were not exempt from taxation during their service, they bore a heavy burden as farmers and it is thought that morale was low.

sen.j: 757年以降は九州からのみの徴用となる。
sen.e: They were only drafted from Kyushu since 757.
From the year 757, soldiers were only conscripted from Kyushu.

sen.j: 平安時代に入り、桓武天皇の792年に健児の制が成立して軍団、兵士が廃止され、国土防衛のため兵士の質よりも数を重視した朝廷は防人廃止を先送りした。
sen.e: The national government in and after Heian period postponed the abolishment of Sakimori since Kondei-no-sei, a military system which abolished corps and troop systems, took effect under Emperor Kanmu's administration in 792, placing more emphasis on quantity than on quality for national defense.

During the Heian period, in 792 during the reign of Emperor Kanmu, the Kondei-no-sei system was established which abolished legions and troops, and the Imperial Court, which placed importance on the quantity rather than the quality of soldiers for national defense, postponed the abolition of sakimori.

sen.j: 実際に防人軍団の外国勢力との交戦は、1019年に中国沿海地方の女真族が対馬から北九州を襲撃した刀伊の入寇の1度だけである。
sen.e: In fact, Sakimori corps had a battle only once, at the time of Toi invasion in 1019, when Jurchens from the coastal region of China invaded northern Kyushu through Tsushima Island.

In actuality, the only conflict to have taken place between sakimori troops and a foreign force was the Toi invasion of 1019 in which Jurchen people from the coastal region of China invaded northern Kyushu through Tsushima Island.

sen.j: 院政期になり北面武士・追捕使・押領使・各地の地方武士団が成立すると、質を重視する院は次第に防人軍団の規模を縮小し、大宰府消滅とともに消えていった。
sen.e: During the period of Insei system, or cloistered rule, when Hokumen Bushi (samurai serving Retired Emperor), Tsuibushi (police), Oryoshi (police and military commander) and regional samurai groups took power, the Retired Emperors, who put more emphasis on the quality, gradually diminished the scale of Sakimori corps, which eventually vanished along with Dazaifu.

When Hokumen no Bushi (Northern Guard), Tsuibushi (Pursuit and Apprehension Agents), Oryoshi (Suppression and Control Agent) and regional samurai groups formed during Japan's period of cloistered imperial rule, the cloistered emperors who emphasized the quality of troops gradually reduced the sizes of sakimori legions, and the system eventually vanished along with the Dazai-fu.

sen.e: "Manyoshu", a collection of poetry created in Nara period, contains more than a hundred poems read by the soliders drafted for Sakimori and their family and they are called Sakimori-no-uta (Sakimori's poems) in general.

"Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), a collection of poetry written during the Nara period, contains more than 100 poems collectively called sakimori-no-uta (Sakimori poems) that were composed by soldiers drafted for sakimori and their family members.
